document.discussion_title: Coke Studio season 2 launches with a massive musical bang
document.topic_text: Coke Studio season 2 launches with a massive musical bang TMG Entertainment | 22 August, 2016 09:55 Lisa Good and Bergie Fresh brought the house down at the launch of Coke Studio season 2 Image by: Jessica Levitt It's the show music lovers have been waiting for. Coke Studio season 2 airs on 27 August and to celebrate there had to be a fab party, obvs. Save & Share Whoah! Watch AKA show off his dance skills - thrusts and all Each week Coke Studio brings together artists from across Africa to come up with original material. All in 48 hours. That means they have to write, produce and perform their hits in two days. No pressure! This season promises to be better than ever with collaborations from the likes of AKA and Nigerian star Patoranking, Cassper Nyovest and Tanzania's Diamond Platnumz and Nasty C with Buffalo Soulja. Whoah! Watch AKA show off his dance skills - thrusts and all The show has been hailed by critics as promoting local music and ensuring that lesser-known artists are given the opportunity to not only work with well known musicians, but also the chance to show their craft on a major musical platform. Halala. To celebrate the start of Coke Studio season 2, a swanky party was held in the heart of Sandton where guests were treated to performances from some of the talent on this season of the show. Nandi Mngoma and DreamTeam's Trey to host new season of Coke Studio Looking radiant in red, Nandia Madida, hosted the event. She's also the host of the show along with DreamTeam's Trey Sineke. Make sure you're in front of the telly come 27 August, e.tv at 6:05pm. Cause this is just a taste of what you're going to get. allowfullscreen This content was produced by the TMG Entertainment team in partnership with Coca-Cola. Share
